title: King Byerd
text:
The King Byerd (or King Bayard) is a <a href="cultivar">cultivar</a> of domesticated <a href="apple">apple</a>, that originated in <a href="Cornwall">Cornwall</a>. It is primarily used for <a href="cooking%20apple">cooking</a>.
The fruit has green skin, which turns yellow when ripened, developing flecks of red and grey <a href="russet%20apple">russet</a>. It is harvested from late October, primarily in <a href="South-East%20England">South-East England</a>. It has a sharp, sweet taste, resulting in its mostly being recommended for cooking meals and <a href="dessert">dessert</a>s. It is considered at its best from January to March, when it mellows to have a sweet, sharp taste. The primary <a href="List%20of%20apple%20diseases">disease</a> affecting the King Byerd cultivar is <a href="apple%20scab">apple scab</a>.
